title: Sjögren syndrome
summary: Sjögren's syndrome (SjS, SS) is a long-term autoimmune disease that affects the body's moisture-producing (lacrimal and salivary) glands,[4] and often seriously affects other organ systems, such as the lungs, kidneys, and nervous system.[8] Primary symptoms are dryness (dry mouth and dry eyes[2]), pain and fatigue.[9] Other symptoms can include dry skin, vaginal dryness, a chronic cough, numbness in the arms and legs, feeling tired, muscle and joint pains, and thyroid problems.[4] Those affected are also at an increased risk (15%) of lymphoma.[2][7]
